definition: to give sb a demerit
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: You get demerits if you miss a meeting .
sentences.chinese: 如果你缺席會議，會被記過的。

sentences.english: Both males and females have their merits and demerits.
sentences.chinese: 男性和女性有他們的優點和記過。

sentences.english: He already has three demerits on his record.
Students who make misprision or forswear shall be given the punishment of serious warning or demerit recording.
sentences.chinese: 知情不報或作僞證者，給予嚴重警告或記過處分。

sentences.english: He gets gigged for being ten minutes late.
sentences.chinese: 他因遲到十分鐘而受到記過處分。

sentences.english: In high school, he was suspended for being late too many times.
sentences.chinese: 在高中，他因爲遲到太多次而被學校記過停學。

to force someone to do something
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
switchboard operator
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)

to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to damn/to curse/to revile
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
proper reason/reasonable grounds
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
long-distance call
